name: Cancer Patients’ Aid Association (CPAA)
remarks: Longstanding NGO for underprivileged cancer patients across South Asia.
description: Founded in Mumbai in 1969, CPAA is one of India’s most enduring NGOs focused on supporting socio-economically underprivileged cancer patients across the country. With branch offices in Mumbai, Delhi, and Pune, it offers free diagnostics, financial assistance, patient counseling, rehabilitation, accommodation, and awareness programs.

name: Indian Cancer Society (ICS)
founded_by: Dr. D. J. Jussawala and Naval Tata
remarks: India's oldest and most comprehensive cancer NGO.
description: Founded in 1951, ICS is India’s oldest cancer NGO, renowned for its focus on early detection, patient rehabilitation, awareness campaigns, and maintenance of cancer registries. It operates mobile units and diagnostic camps nationwide.

name: Cuddles Foundation
coverage: 30+ government and charity hospitals across 20+ cities
remarks: India’s only pediatric oncology nutrition NGO.
description: Established in Mumbai in 2013, Cuddles is India’s only NGO solely dedicated to pediatric oncology nutrition. It partners with over 30 government and charity hospitals across 20+ cities, placing trained pediatric nutritionists to improve survival outcomes.

name: St. Jude India ChildCare Centres
remarks: Safe, hygienic, and supportive stay for children with cancer.
description: St. Jude provides comprehensive support to families of children undergoing cancer treatment. It runs 41 centers in 11 Indian cities offering free accommodation, nutritious food, counseling, play sessions, and educational support.

name: CanSupport
remarks: Pioneered palliative care services in India.
description: Founded in 1996 by Harmala Gupta in Delhi, CanSupport pioneered cancer palliative home care in India, serving through home visits, counseling, and clinics. It was recognized by WHO in 2017 as a Public Health Champion.

name: CAPED Trust
description: Founded in 2014, CAPED Trust focuses on cervical cancer screening and awareness among low-income women. It runs community screening camps and educational programs in underserved areas of India.

name: Tata Cancer Care Foundation (TCCF)
coverage: Pan-India (notably Assam, Jharkhand, Odisha, Madhya Pradesh)
remarks: Works with Tata Memorial and state hospitals.
description: An initiative of Tata Trusts, TCCF builds screening clinics and hospital infrastructure in underserved Indian states, and trains medical staff. It collaborates with Tata Memorial Hospital and regional governments.

name: Cancer Foundation of India (CFI)
coverage: Pan-India with a base in West Bengal
description: Founded in 2002, the Cancer Foundation of India focuses on cancer prevention programs, particularly HPV vaccination and anti-tobacco campaigns. It works closely with WHO and other global health bodies.

name: Nargis Dutt Foundation (NDF)
description: Founded by actor-politician Sunil Dutt in memory of his wife, the Nargis Dutt Foundation funds rural cancer screening and ICU equipment. It operates internationally and engages in high-impact awareness projects.

name: Maina Foundation
remarks: Promotes early detection of breast cancer.
description: Maina Foundation conducts workshops, screening drives, and awareness campaigns focused on early detection and prevention of breast cancer, especially targeting women in urban areas.
